definitions.definition: to take back something that was yours:
examples: You'll be able to reclaim the tax on all equipment that you buy.

definitions.definition: to make land, such as desert or areas covered by water, suitable for farming or building
to treat waste materials in order to get useful materials, such as glass or paper, that can be used again
the act of collecting your bags after they have been taken off a plane at the end of a flight, or the area of an airport where you do this:
examples: We spent an hour in baggage/luggage reclaim waiting for our suitcases.
